Class ConsoleInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • ConsoleInput

  • public class ConsoleInput
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to read user input form the console. There are methods to read strings, integers and doubles. Integers and doubles can be read as intervals.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.Scanner scan
      Objekt to capture console input.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private ConsoleInput()
      Pivate constructor to prevent instances of this Class.

      • readString

        public static java.lang.String readString(java.lang.String info)
        Prints an infotext for the user, reads input as string and returns it.
        Parameters:
        info - Information fuer den Benutzer.
        Returns:

      • readInt

        public static int readInt()
        Reads an integer value from the console and returns it.
        Returns:
        Readed Integer.

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(java.lang.String info)
        Prints an information for the user, reads a string from the console and tryes to convert the string into an Integer. If there is a parse error, the user gets informed by an errortext and prompted to enter a valid number again. As soon the convertion is successfull, the integer gets returned.
        Parameters:
        info - Information to the user.
        Returns:
        Readed String.

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(int min,
          int max)
        Reads an integer in between an interval from the console and returns it.
        Parameters:
        min - Interval top bound.
        max - Interval lower bound.
        Returns:
        Readed integer from the interval.

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(java.lang.String info,
          int min,
          int max)
        Prints an information to the user, reads an integer in between an given interval and returns it. Is the Integer not between the given interval, an errormessage is displayed and the user gets prompted to enter a new integer until there is a valid input.
        Parameters:
        info - Information to the user.
        min - Interval top bound.
        max - Interval lower bound.
        Returns:
        Readed integer from the given interval.

      • readDouble

        public static double readDouble()
        Reads a string from the console converted to a floating-point number.
        Returns:
        Readed floating-point number.

      • readDouble

        public static double readDouble(java.lang.String info)
        Prints an information to the console and reads a string converted to a floating-point number. If there is a convertion error, the user gets prompted to reenter a valid floating-point.
        Parameters:
        info - Information to the user.
        Returns:
        Readed floating-point number as double.

      • readDouble

        public static double readDouble(double min,
                double max)
        Reads a string from the console, converted into a floating-point number in between a given interval and returns it.
        Parameters:
        min - Interval top bound.
        max - Interval lower bound.
        Returns:
        Readed floating-point number in the interval.

      • readDouble

        public static double readDouble(java.lang.String info,
                double min,
                double max)
        Prints an information to the user and reads a floating-point number in between a certain interval from the console. If the input is not a number or the number is not in between the interval, it returns an error and prompts the user to reenter a correct value. As soon as the input value is valid the floating-point number gets returned.
        Parameters:
        info - Infotext for the user.
        min - Interval top bound.
        max - Interval lower bound.
        Returns:
        Readed floating-point in a certain interval from the console.
